data.content: Job Title: Senior Accountant  Job Type: On-site - Permanent (Full-time)  Job Sector: #Accounting_and_finance  Work Location: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia  Experience Level: Expert  Applicants Needed: Female  Salary/Compensation: Monthly  Deadline: 12/3/2024  Description: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Accountant to join our team. Responsibilities:      Manage and oversee the daily operations of the accounting department     Prepare financial statements and reports for management     Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff     Ensure compliance with accounting policies and procedures     Review and analyze financial data to support business decisions     Assist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts     Coordinate with external auditors during annual audits     Identify areas for process improvement and implement changes as needed  Requirements:      Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance     CPA certification preferred     5+ years of accounting experience, with at least 2 years in a senior accounting role     Proficiency in financial accounting software and Microsoft Excel     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills     Ability to work independently and as part of a team     Experience working in an agency environment is a plus  If you meet the above requirements and are looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity as a Senior Accountant, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and contribute to our continued success! Job Title: Chief Compliance Officer (CCO)/ Head of Compliance  Job Type: On-site - Permanent (Full-time)  Job Sector: #Accounting_and_finance  Work Location: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia  Experience Level: Intermediate  Vacancies: 1  Salary/Compensation: Monthly  Deadline: 12/3/2024  Description: About the Role: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Chief Compliance Officer (CCO)/ Head of Compliance to join our team. As the CCO, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our company, a new Capital Market Service Provider, adheres strictly to all applicable laws, regulatory directives, and internal policies. Your leadership will be instrumental in developing and implementing policies designed to ensure compliance and minimize potential losses from non-compliance.  Key Responsibilities: -Oversee and ensure compliance with all relevant legal and regulatory requirements. -Develop, implement, and monitor effective compliance policies and procedures. -Lead risk management initiatives, focusing on operational and regulatory risks. -Keep abreast of, and advise on, changes in the legal and regulatory environment. -Collaborate with different staffs to ensure company-wide compliance. -Conduct regular compliance audits and reviews.  Minimum Qualifications: -A first degree or equivalent in Law(high preference for law), Management, Accounting, or Finance from a recognized institution of higher learning.  Preferred Certifications: -CPA licensing and registration by the pertinent government organ in Ethiopia (advantageous but not compulsory). -CAMS certification from ACAMS or Certified Fraud Examiner from ACFE (considered advantageous).  Minimum Experience: -At least three (3) years' post-graduation experience in risk, control, compliance, law, or equivalent within the financial services industry; or five (5) years' relevant post-graduation experience in the financial services industry.  Technical Skills: -Profound knowledge of Capital Market operations. -Strong understanding of the business operations of a Capital Market Service Provider. -Proficient in risk management (including operational and regulatory risks). -Familiarity with relevant laws, directives, and regulations. -Basic financial analysis skills. -Knowledge of Anti-Money Laundering/Combating the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT).  Soft Skills: -Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. -Effective coordination and organizational abilities. -Strong critical analysis and problem-solving skills. -Excellent interpersonal skills. -Proven team management and leadership capabilities. -Meticulous attention to detail.  Application Process: Interested candidates are invited to submit their CV and a cover letter detailing their qualifications, experience and how they can handle the listed responsibilities to capitalproject@mazethiopiatrading.com  __________________  Private Client  2 Jobs Posted       From: @freelance_ethio | @freelanceethbot  For our Amharic Channel, Join @afriworkamharic

Job Title: Securities Trader (Appointed Representative)  Job Type: On-site - Permanent (Full-time)  Job Sector: #Accounting_and_finance  Work Location: Addis Ababa, Ethiopia  Experience Level: Intermediate  Salary/Compensation: Monthly  Deadline: 12/3/2024  Description: About the Role: MAZ Capital is seeking a skilled and experienced Securities Trader to join our team as an Appointed Representative. In this vital role, you will be responsible for executing client instructions/mandates and handling transactions for our proprietary account. This role also requires obtaining an appointed representative license from the authority. As part of this process, the selected candidate will undertake a licensing examination and be interviewed by the authority to ensure full compliance and qualification for the role.  Key Responsibilities: -Execute and manage trading activities based on client instructions. -Implement transactions for the proprietary account of the sponsoring Capital Market Service Provider. -Stay updated on market trends, economic indicators, and other relevant financial news. -Comply with all regulatory guidelines and company policies in trading activities. -Analyze market conditions to make informed trading decisions.  Minimum Qualifications: A first degree or its equivalent in any discipline from a recognized institution of higher learning.  Preferred Certifications: A Level 3 qualification certificate from the Chartered Institute for Securities and Investment (CISI) is preferable. If not currently held, the company is willing to sponsor and pay for the right candidate to obtain this certification.  Minimum Experience: At least three (3) years of post-graduation experience in the financial services industry.  Technical Skills: -Comprehensive knowledge of the workings of the Capital Market and the financial services industry. -Strong understanding of economic indicators and parameters. -Familiarity with relevant laws, directives, and regulations. -Proficient in trading strategies, associated risks, and risk management.  Soft Skills: -Excellent interpersonal skills. -Strong research and analytical skills.  Application Process: Interested candidates are invited to submit their CV and a cover letter detailing their qualifications, experience and how they can handle the listed responsibilities to capitalproject@mazethiopiatrading.com  __________________  Private Client  1 Jobs Posted       From: @freelance_ethio | @freelanceethbot  For our Amharic Channel, Join @afriworkamharic
